PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a mountain near Lucerne, Switzerland. Jurisdiction over
is divided between the cantons of Obwalden, Nidwalden, and Lucerne.
is in Obwalden right on the border with Nidwalden.

The top can be reached with the Pilatus Railway, the worldâ€™s steepest cogwheel railway from Alpnachstad, operating from May to November (depending on snow conditions), and the whole year with the aerial panorama gondolas and aerial cableways from Kriens.
has the longest summer toboggan track in Switzerland (0.88 miles or 1.350 km) and the biggest suspension rope park in Central Switzerland.

During the summer, the "Golden Round Trip" - a popular route for tourists - involves taking a boat from Lucerne across Lake Lucerne to Alpnachstad, going up on the cogwheel railway, coming down on the aerial cableways and panorama gondolas, and taking a bus back to Lucerne.
was named after a local legend which alleges that Pontius Pilate was buried there.
Numbered amongst those who have reached
summit are Conrad Gessner, Queen Victoria and Lenin.
